The Catholic University of Korea: The Catholic University of Korea (Korean: 가톨릭대학교  Hanja: 天主教大學校) is a private Roman Catholic university in Bucheon-si, Gyeonggi-do, South Korea. It was established in 1855. The Catholic University of Korea operates campuses in Seoul and in the neighboring Bucheon City. The university's school of medicine operates eight affilated hospitals throughout the country.
